result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Penn by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Attorney Penn enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas and sets pre trial for June 14th at 10:15 am. Attorney Penn makes arguments on bond. Court denies motion and continues. bond.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Jolin appearing specially. ADA Brown appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received complaint. Attorney Jolin request bond modification. Court modifies bond to $250.00 cash. Conditions, no contact with Rachel Mayo. Court sets preliminary hearing for April 7th at 8:30 am.

Defendant Michael S Johnson appeared by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Jolin appearing specially. Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is public Defender eligible and they are working on appointing counsel. Attorney Jolin speaks on bond. Court denies motion to modify bond. Court adjourns initial appearance to March 30th at 1:00 pm. bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Nagel appearing specially in court. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause in this matter. Court sets $2000.00 cash bond. Conditions, No contact with Rachel Mayo. Court sets initial appearance to March 23rd at 1:00 pm.
